mini_bio: A ü¶Ñ developer, designer, and DJ. I build tools with Rust & Svelte, maintain FOSS projects, work at {companyName}, and spin DJ sets on weekends ‚úåÔ∏è
portfolio_afterparty_description: Event photo management platform, with 4K storage, multiplayer, and built-in engagement features.
portfolio_godot_wry_description: Rust-based extension that integrates platform-specific webviews into Godot games (without extra dependencies).
portfolio_powershift_description: Field service management mobile app for utility workers with a web dashboard.
portfolio_ssn_description: A Minecraft server with no rules, a persistent map, and open-source plugins and configs.
portfolio_gachapon_description: It makes tiny happy noises when you're not paying attention...
newsletter_subtitle: I'll hit you up via email when there's a new post or when I've got something cool to share, no fixed schedule. You can unsubscribe whenever you want.
portfolio_afterparty_details:
I'm currently developing a platform for organisers to manage and share event photos and keep engaging with their audience even after the party is over.

• Uploaded images and videos are compressed with high quality and small file sizes.
• All processing happens on client-side, reducing server usage and costs.
portfolio_afterparty_media_dashboard: Dashboard for organisers to manage their photo albums (WIP).
portfolio_afterparty_media_mobile: Mobile view for a photographer's profile (WIP).
portfolio_afterparty_media_demo: Early product demo video for Afterparty.
portfolio_godot_wry_details:
A lightweight Rust extension that bridges native system webviews directly into Godot 4's scene tree. No Chromium bloat, no extra dependencies.

• Bidirectional JavaScript ‚Üî GDScript communication.
• Local resource serving via "res://" protocol for embedded webapps.
• Input event forwarding maintaining game/webview interactions.
• Cross-platform support leveraging each OS's native webview.
portfolio_godot_wry_media_docs: Godot WRY documentation's homepage running inside a Godot scene.
portfolio_godot_wry_media_simple_demo: Transparent webview integration within a Godot scene.
portfolio_godot_wry_media_cas: Live demo of a character creator UI made with Godot WRY.
portfolio_powershift_details:
Offline-first mobile app designed for utility field workers who operate in dead zones. Built with real-time sync, GPS tracking, and role-based dashboards that work without an internet connection.

• Background job queuing with conflict resolution for offline tasks.
• Real-time fleet management with geolocation tracking.
• Multi-tenant architecture supporting different companies.
• Data caching and syncing for usage without internet.
portfolio_powershift_media_mobile: Mobile interface for a squad shift start.
portfolio_powershift_media_dashboard: Dashboard showing status and details of a squad's shift.
portfolio_ssn_details:
Running Brazil's longest-standing anarchy Minecraft server with 5+ years of a persistent world. Zero rules, infinite world, and a fully open-source plugin ecosystem.

• Custom authentication system enabling cracked client access.
• Persistent world with 317GB+ of player-generated content since 2020.
• Open-source plugin architecture with community contributions.
• Optimizations supporting 4,400+ unique players.
portfolio_powershift_media_mobile_data: Data tab for debugging on mobile.
portfolio_powershift_media_devlog: I send dev update videos like this periodically for my freelance clients so they can see their project actually coming to life.
upcoming_talks_empty: My schedule is free for talks in the upcoming months...
giving_talks_subtitle: If you are organizing a frontend or Rust related conference or meetup, I'd be happy to give a talk!
giving_talks_subjects: Subjects I'm always interested in presenting:
giving_talks_subject_svelte: Svelte, SvelteKit and frontend in general.
giving_talks_subject_rust: Fun ways to use Rust outside the web.
giving_talks_languages: I'm comfortable speaking in Brazilian Portuguese and English.
giving_talks_in_person_availability: I'm available for both in-person and online talks.
giving_talks_in_person_expectations: For in-person talks, I would expect my travel and accommodation to be covered.
giving_talks_international_expectations: For conferences outside of South America, Schengen area, and United States, I would need some assistance on the business visa application.
giving_talks_cta: You can reach me out at the contact page. Looking forward to it!
speaker_info_subtitle: You can use the following information to present me:
name: Name
my_minibio: A unicorn developer, designer, and DJ. Builds tools with Rust & Svelte, maintains open-source projects, and spin DJ sets on weekends.
about_me_subtitle: Me talking about me... just for you!
dislikes_networking: Networking for the sake of it
personally_intro: I'm Doce Fernandes, a curious, nice, and queer person from a small town in Minas Gerais, Brazil, that moved to S√£o Paulo for a year, and is now living in Belo Horizonte. The journey from leaving the heartland, to living in the most populous city in Brazil, then finding myself in between has been wild...
personally_work: I make my living as a Frontend Developer at Rail Europe, where I get to build actually cool stuff and have the means to experiment with more than just the web, which is great.
personally_early_days: My programming journey started in 2015 with VB.NET, which feels like a lifetime ago. From there it was this whole chaotic path through random projects until eventually landing my first actual job in 2018.
personally_hobbies: When I'm not coding (rare), you'll find me looking for vinyl records, fighting against Fruity Loops, or chilling in the voice chat. I'm obsessed with hyperpop and more experimental music, especially the local scene, and I love mixing Brazilian Funk with other electronic sounds.
map_distance: I'm from Belo Horizonte, Brazil, roughly {km}km away from your current location, according to your IP address.
map_distance_fallback: I'm from Belo Horizonte, Brazil! I wonder where you're from...
music_taste_subtitle: I would say my taste is a bit all over the place... So let me fetch my Last.fm data to tell you about it instead.
about_dj_subtitle: Sometimes I try making my own music. I still don't quite have the skills to make what I envision, but it's fun anyways.
lets_have_fun_description: Don't be shy! I'm everywhere online (footer has the links) but active the most on Discord. I'm always excited to meet new humans. Just please don't send a plain "hey" and nothing else, give me something to work with lol.
ai_usage_subtitle: This page is my AI manifesto.
ai_usage_description:
Everything you see here was made by me. The code, the design, the writing, everything. It all comes from things I've learned, things I've felt, and things I wanted to exist.

I do lightly use LLMs and AI as a tool. Not to generate content, but to support my process. That is, mostly translation and proofreading. All the creative process is my work. I also don't use any AI pair programmers solely as a personal choice.

This site is not a portfolio (even tho I also use it as such), it's a personal playground. I break things because I want to understand them and I leave things unfinished because I want to code them myself.

And while we're at it... I'm not into AI-generated art or music. I'm very much not insterested in soulless generated slop.

I like my stuff human :)
